caption.title: Primary efficacy outcomes by 60 days from randomisation in the per-protocol population

tr.td: New MRI-proven brain infarction or death*
Aspirin 81 mg vs placebo: −10.1% (-29.7 to 11.0%) Aspirin 1000 mg vs placebo: −19.4% (-37.4 to 0.6%)
Aspirin 81 mg vs placebo: −15.2% (-33.2 to 4.3%) Aspirin 1000 mg vs placebo: −12.6% (-31.0 to 6.6%)
Aspirin 81 mg vs placebo: 1.8% (-14.4 to 19.1%) Aspirin 1000 mg vs placebo: −11.1% (-25.3 to 1.8%)

fn.p: *10 participants (five placebo, 4 aspirin 81 mg, 1 aspirin 1000 mg) did not have MRI information at either baseline (±7 days) or day 60 (±10 days). One participant (placebo) had both a new MRI-proven brain infraction event and death.
